body_html:
@johnsrude Tensorflow can already be built with Bazel on Windows, incremental build supported and is much faster than CMake + MSBuild (Bazel build took me 3 hours in my low-end laptop while MSBuild took about 9 hours).

CMake + Ninja will be much faster than CMake + MSBuild as Ninja can do incremental build, probably on par with Bazel. However, for some unknown reason Tensorflow's CMake build scripts are so tuned to MSBuild that Ninja simply does not work.

body:
@johnsrude Tensorflow can already be built with Bazel on Windows, incremental build supported and is much faster than CMake + MSBuild (Bazel build took me 3 hours in my low-end laptop while MSBuild took about 9 hours).

CMake + Ninja will be much faster than CMake + MSBuild as Ninja can do incremental build, probably on par with Bazel. However, for some unknown reason Tensorflow's CMake build scripts are so tuned to MSBuild that Ninja simply does not work.
